magpie.models.regression

Class LASSORegression

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.models.BaseModel
      • magpie.models.regression.BaseRegression
        • magpie.models.regression.LASSORegression
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, AbstractRegressionModel, Citable, Commandable, Options, Printable, Savable

    public class LASSORegression
extends BaseRegression
    This class enables regression using the LASSO algorithm, as described by this page. It is basically linear regression with some additional constraints to make the solution vector have a low L1 norm.

    For now, this uses Forward Stepwise Regression.

    Usage: -maxterms <terms>
    terms: Maximum number of terms allowed in expression

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • findMaxCorrelation

        protected int findMaxCorrelation(double[][] features,
                     double[] objective,
                     boolean[] isSearchable)
        Finds the feature with the maximum correlation out of all possible candidates
        Parameters:
        features - Features for each measurement
        objective - Objective function for each measurement
        isSearchable - List of which features are searchable
        Returns:
        Index of feature that is searchable and has the highest correlation coefficient. Return -1 if no features are left to add.

      • linearFit

                 boolean intercept)
        Find the best linear fit
        Parameters:
        x - Independent variable
        y - Dependent variable
        intercept - Whether to fit an intercept
        Returns:
        Optimal fit: [0] is the intercept, [1] is the slope

      • printModelDescriptionDetails

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> printModelDescriptionDetails(boolean htmlFormat)
        Description copied from class: BaseModel
        Print details of the model. Used by BaseModel.printDescription(boolean).

        Implementation note: No not add indentation for details. That is handled by BaseModel.printDescription(boolean). You should also call the super operation to get the Normalizer and Attribute selector settings

        Overrides:
        printModelDescriptionDetails in class BaseModel
        Parameters:
        htmlFormat - Whether to use HTML format
        Returns:
        List describing model details. Each entry is a different line of the description (i.e., in place of newline characters).
